titles.title: Jungle Taitei Susume Leo!
New Jungle Emperor, Go Ahead Leo!
Jungle Emperor, Onward Leo!
Der Löwenkönig
Boubou, der Löwenkönig
Kimba Il Leone Bianco II
Jungle Emperor Leo
Jungle Taitei Susume Leo
ジャングル大帝 進めレオ!
Leo the Lion
Boubou, König der Tiere
Le roi Léo (1966)
الليث الأبيض

relatedanime.anime: Jungle Taitei: Yuuki ga Mirai o Kaeru

anime.description: Jungle Emperor was such a hit in Japan, that Dr. Tezuka went ahead and produced a sequel in 1966, known in Japan as "The New Jungle Emperor" or "Onward, Leo!" The trouble (for us in the rest of the world) was that he made the series without having a deal with NBC, and he made it more like his original manga story, which means that there were a lot of characters that died and some of the episodes could be depressing. NBC thought that there was no way they could sell that kind of show, and they were quite happy with the 52 episodes they had, so the New Jungle Emperor series wasn`t seen in this country until 1984, when it was given the title Leo The Lion. This series was supposed to take place a few years after the original Kimba series. Kimba was an adult, with Kitty as his mate, and they had two cubs. Most of all this series was the story of Rune, the male cub, as he grew and learned to be as strong as his father. For legal reasons, the producers of the English-dubbed version could not use the name Kimba, so they used the original Japanese names for all the characters. Source: kimbawlion.com/verspage.htm

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Africa
tag.description: The world`s second-largest continent and the birthplace of the human species, Africa is a place of a huge diversity, with deserts and savannas, with famine and precious stones, with cultural and economical riches of all kinds. Throughout history, Africa has been the cradle of empires and has been ruled by foreign powers, and as of the early 21st century sees swift changes and economic boom going side by side with inhuman levels of poverty.

episode.title: 白い王者
White King
La route secrète
episode.summary: A story about spies and scientists. A boy is abandoned in Leo`s jungle when his grandfather is kidnapped. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 青いたてがみのザンバ
Zamba of the Blue Mane
Le lion bleu
episode.summary: Leo learns the reason a blue lion is so antagonistic. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 月光石の秘密
The Secret of Moonlight Stone
Le secret de la Lune bleue
episode.summary: The powerful moonstones are the quest in this spoof of James Bond movies. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 銀色の狼
The Silver Wolf
Le loup argenté
episode.summary: A plane transporting Russian wolves crashes in the jungle. The wolves take Rukio prisoner as they try to find a way to survive. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: ルバー谷の決闘
Duel at Lubar Valley
La vallée des léopards
episode.summary: Leo becomes involved in a bizarre revenge match between a blind man and a leopard. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: ジャングルを売った奴
The Man Who Sold the Jungle
La fièvre de l`or
episode.summary: The hyenas, under an enormous Godfather-like leader, trap Leo into helping with a deadly plan. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 恐怖の鳥
The Bird of Terror
Les oiseaux migrateurs
episode.summary: A threatening flock of falcons invades Leo`s jungle. Another surprising bit of stylized animation as Leo rescues Rune. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 火山島の冒険
Adventure at Volcano Island
Bill et Julie
episode.summary: Rune and Rukio help a blind buffalo. Both cubs show increasing independence in this episode. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 密林の黒い牙
The Black Monster in the Jungle
Lily la panthère
episode.summary: The trauma of a plane crash causes a woman`s pet leopard to go wild. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 大草原の対決
Confrontation in the Grasslands
La carte
episode.summary: Leo gets the animals to report the dangers they encounter so that others may learn to avoid them. A bit of tension as Leo meets an attractive female lion, but nothing comes of it. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 象の墓場
The Elephants` Graveyard
Le patriarche
episode.summary: Thousands of hungry and thirsty elephants approach Leo`s jungle. The resident herd of elephants does not want to allow them to live there. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: ピグミーの死のまつり
The Pygmys` Death Dance
La dernière chasse
episode.summary: A hunt for Leo results in him being temporarily blinded. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 王城に陽は昇る
The Sun Will Rise Again over the Royal Castle
Les tâches maléfiques
episode.summary: A spotted fever plague sweeps through the jungle, affecting most of the animals. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 白い絶壁
The White Cliff
Le barrage
episode.summary: The surrounding area is engulfed in an advancing flood. Leo finds that the cause of the flood is a new dam. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: ムーン山よ永遠に
The Eternal Mount Moon
La montagne de Lune
episode.summary: Leo accompanies an expedition to Mt. Moon to search for the moonlight stones, which can solve the world`s energy shortage. Rune stows away with the expedition. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 吠える氷河
The Glacier That Roared
Le tombeau de glace
episode.summary: The mysterious mammoth reveals that other prehistoric creatures still exist as well. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: ひとりぼっちの墓
The Lonesome Tomb
L`exclu
episode.summary: A giraffe has strange markings which make it an outcast from its herd, and desired by hunters. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 密猟者の森
The Poachers` Forest
Les braconniers
episode.summary: One of the strongest episodes of the entire Leo series, dealing powerfully with the harm done by poaching. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: パンジャ街へ行く
Panja Goes to Town
Les voleurs
episode.summary: Rune thinks he is protecting it when he places Panja`s hide in a tree. It is spotted by men in a helicopter who take it to a city. The white lion skin is swapped about through lies and corruption while Leo and Rune try to get it back. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: ルネの冒険旅行
Lune`s Adventurous Trip
Les premiers pas
episode.summary: Rune and Rukio are born to Leo and Lea. The best episode so far, as Leo decides that Rune needs some help to be up to the life that awaits him. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: リカオンは啼かず
Ricaons Do Not Cry
Le prédateur
episode.summary: An enemy of Leo`s befriends Rune and Rukio. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 巨獣ドンベ
Huge Beast Donbe
La grande vallée
episode.summary: A peaceful band of gorillas, dependent on a giant for their safety, seek a new home. Rukio gets to shine in this episode, as she befriends a fearsome, and fearful, gorilla. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 黄金の弓
The Golden Bow
Tome et l`arc d`or
episode.summary: Two people, a father and son, are the last survivors of their tribe. Because they possess a golden bow, they are pursued throughout Africa. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 機関車騒動
Confusion in the Locomotive
Le chemin de fer
episode.summary: The obnoxious elephant, Bizo, must cooperate with Rune or both of them will die! Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 石のとりで
The Stone Fortress
La maison des animaux
episode.summary: Rune gets the idea to build a stone castle as protection against disasters like fire. Source: kimbawlion.com

episode.title: 悪魔の滝
The Devil`s Waterfall
Les chutes du démon
episode.summary: Leo reluctantly aids Totto (Cassius) the panther who, at the first opportunity, tries to kill Rune and Rukio. Leo`s rage is so great that he inadvertently hurts Mandy (Dan`l). Source: kimbawlion.com
